conclusion: To find the average velocity and average speed of the particle, we need to analyze the given information and apply the relevant formulas.
The particle moves along two semi-circular arcs from point A to point C.
Each semi-circular arc has a radius R = 1 m.
The circumference of a full circle is 2πR.
Since each arc is a semi-circle, the length of one semi-circular arc is πR.
The total distance traveled is the sum of the lengths of the two semi-circular arcs: Total distance = πR + πR = 2πR.
Substituting R = 1 m: Total distance = 2π × 1 = 2π m.
Average speed is defined as the total distance traveled divided by the total time taken.
The total time taken is 5 seconds.
Average speed = Total distance / Total time = 2π m / 5 s = 2π/5 m/s.
Displacement is the straight-line distance between the initial and final positions.
From the diagram, the particle moves from point A to point C, which is a straight line along the horizontal axis.
The displacement is the distance between A and C, which is twice the radius of the semi-circles: Displacement = 2R = 2 × 1 = 2 m.
Average velocity is defined as the displacement divided by the total time taken.
Average velocity = Displacement / Total time = 2 m / 5 s = 0.4 m/s.
